9.3. Elements

case
contains grammatical case information given by a dictionary for a given form. 辞書中における格情報を示す．
colloc
collocate
contains a collocate of the headword. 見出し語の連語関係を示す．
def
definition
contains definition text in a dictionary entry. 辞書項目における定義を示す．
dictScrap
dictionary scrapNo ja for "dictionary scrap"
encloses a part of a dictionary entry in which other phrase-level dictionary elements are freely combined. 句レベルの辞書要素をとる辞書項目を示す．
entry
contains a reasonably well-structured dictionary entry. それなりに構造化されている辞書項目を示す．
entryFree
unstructured entryNo ja for "unstructured entry"
contains a dictionary entry which does not necessarily conform to the constraints imposed by the entry element. 要素entryにある制約に必ずしも従わない辞書項目を示す．
etym
etymology
encloses the etymological information in a dictionary entry. 辞書項目の語源情報を示す．
form
form information group
groups all the information on the written and spoken forms of one headword. ひとつの見出し語の書記または発話形式の情報を全てまとめる．
 
 @type
classifies form as simple, compound, etc. 単純形，複合形などに分類する．
 
  simple
single free lexical item ひとつの語彙項目．
  lemma
the headword itself 見出し語．
  variant
a variant form 異形．
  compound
word formed from simple lexical items ひとつの語彙項目から作られた単語．
  derivative
word derived from headword 見出し語から派生した単語．
  inflected
word in other than usual dictionary form 一般的な辞書の形式にはない単語．
  phrase
multiple-word lexical item 複合語である語彙項目．
gen
gender
identifies the morphological gender of a lexical item, as given in the dictionary. 辞書中の語彙項目にある文法形態素の性を示す．
gram
grammatical information
within an entry in a dictionary or a terminological data file, contains grammatical information relating to a term, word, or form. 辞書や用語集のデータ中にある，用語，単語，形式に関する文法情報を示す．
 
 @type
classifies the grammatical information given according to some convenient typology — in the case of terminological information, preferably the dictionary of data element types specified in ISO WD 12 620. 当該文法情報の分類を示す．用語を示す場合，ISO WD 12620に従うこ とが望ましい．
 
  pos
part of speechNo ja for "part of speech"
any of the word classes to which a word may be assigned in a given language, based on form, meaning, or a combination of features, e.g. noun, verb, adjective, etc. 当該語に関する分類．形，意味，素性の組み合わせなどによる． 例えば，名詞，動詞，形容詞など．
  gen
genderNo ja for "gender"
formal classification by which nouns and pronouns, and often accompanying modifiers, are grouped and inflected, or changed in form, so as to control certain syntactic relationships 文法上の性．時に修飾詞を伴う名詞や代名詞がまとまり，屈折，す なわち語形変形が行われ，ある統語的関係が示される．
  num
numberNo ja for "number"
grammatical number, e.g. singular, plural, dual, … 文法上の数．単数，複数，双数など．
  animate
animate or inanimate 生物，無生物．
  proper
proper noun or common noun 固有名詞，一般名詞．
gramGrp
grammatical information group
groups morpho-syntactic information about a lexical item, e.g. pos, gen, number, case, or iType (inflectional class). 語彙項目，の形態統語情報，例えば，gen, number, case, iTypeをまとめる．
hom
homograph
groups information relating to one homograph within an entry. 項目中にあるひとつの同綴異義語に関する情報をまとめる．
hyph
hyphenation
contains a hyphenated form of a dictionary headword, or hyphenation information in some other form. 辞書の見出しにあるハイフン付き語形，または他の語形にあるハイフン情報 を示す．
iType
inflectional class
indicates the inflectional class associated with a lexical item. 語彙項目の屈折の種類を示す．
 
 @type
indicates the type of indicator used to specify the inflection class, when it is necessary to distinguish between the usual abbreviated indications (e.g. inv) and other kinds of indicators, such as special codes referring to conjugation patterns, etc. 一般的な省略形とは異なる指標，例えば活用パタンを表す特別な記号を 分ける必要がある場合に，屈折の種類を示す指標の種類を示す．
 
  abbrev
abbreviated indicator 省略指標．
  verbTable
coded reference to a table of verbs 動詞一覧へのコード付き参照．
lang
language name
name of a language mentioned in etymological or other linguistic discussion. 語源学または他の言語学上の論議で現れる言語名を示す．
lbl
label
contains a label for a form, example, translation, or other piece of information, e.g. abbreviation for, contraction of, literally, approximately, synonyms:, etc. 語形のラベルを示す．例えば，翻訳，短縮形などの各種省略形など．
 
 @type
classifies the label using any convenient typology. 当該ラベルの分類を示す．
mood
contains information about the grammatical mood of verbs (e.g. indicative, subjunctive, imperative). 文法上の動詞の法に関する情報を示す．例えば，直説法，仮定法，命令法な ど．
number
indicates grammatical number associated with a form, as given in a dictionary. 辞書において，語形と関連する文法上の数を示す．
oRef
orthographic-form referenceNo ja for "orthographic-form reference"
in a dictionary example, indicates a reference to the orthographic form(s) of the headword. 辞書の用例において，見出し語の正書形式への参照を示す．
 
 @type
indicates the kind of typographic modification made to the headword in the reference. 参照中，見出し語に施された印刷上の修飾の種類を示す．
 
  cap
capitalNo ja for "capital"
indicates first letter is given as capital 冒頭文字が大文字化されている．
  noHyph

oVar

 @type

 @extent

  full

 @level

10. [msdescription] Manuscript Description

10.1. Attribute classes

att.msExcerpt
manuscript excerptNo ja for "manuscript excerpt"
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof. 手書き資料からの引用を記述するための属性を示す．
 
 @defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage. 当該部分に問題があるかどうかを示す．例えば，欠損や損傷による不完 全さなど．

10.2. Model classes

att.msExcerpt
manuscript excerptNo ja for "manuscript excerpt"
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof. 手書き資料からの引用を記述するための属性を示す．
 
 @defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage. 当該部分に問題があるかどうかを示す．例えば，欠損や損傷による不完 全さなど．

10.3. Elements

accMat
accompanying materialNo ja for "accompanying material"
contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period. 当該手書き資料と関連する情 報の詳細を記述するための要素．例えば，当該手書き資料が書かれた時代と は異なる時期の文書や断片についてについての詳細を示す．例えば，当該手 書き資料が作成された以前に書かれた文書やその断片であったりするものに ついて．
acquisition
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution. 当該手書き資料が入手された経緯についての情報を示す．
additional
groups additional information, combining bibliographic information about a manuscript, or surrogate copies of it with curatorial or administrative information. 当該手書き資料に関する書誌情報などの付随情報まとめる．または当該資料 の複製に関する管理情報をまとめる．
additions
contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript, such as marginalia or other annotations. 当該手書き資料中にある，重要な付加物を示す．例えば，欄外の書き込みや 注釈など．
adminInfo
administrative information
contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript, and also about the record description itself. 当該手書き資料，またはその記録文書そのものの管理・利用形態についての情 報を示す．
altIdentifier
alternative identifier
contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number. 当該手書き資料を示す，代わりとなるIDまたは昔のIDを示す．例えば，昔の カタログ番号など．
binding
contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript. 1つの装訂に関する情報を示す．例えば，手書き資料でいうカバーの種類， 表紙など．
 
 @contemporary
specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents 当該装訂が，当該内容の大部分と同年代のものかどうかを示す．
bindingDesc
binding descriptionNo ja for "binding description"
describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript. 手書き資料の現行または以前の装訂に関する情報を示す．一連の段落または 一連の要素bindingで示される．各単位が当該手書き資料の各装訂 に対応する．
catchwords
describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up a codex or incunable, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page. 古典籍において，冊子や初期刊本の折丁の順番を正しくするために使用され るシステムを示す．一般には，ページの脚に注釈(つなぎことば)を記す．
collation
contains a description of how the leaves or bifolia are physically arranged. 当該の葉または一度折られた折丁が，物理的にどのように構成されているか を示す．
collection
contains the name of a collection of manuscripts, not necessarily located within a single repository. 手書き資料のコレクション名を示す．必ずしも一ヶ所に保管されている必要 はない．
colophon
contains the colophon of a manuscript item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript. 当該手書き資料のコロフォン(奥付情報)を示す．例えば，制 作の日時，場所，主体，制作主体，制作理由など．
condition
contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript. 当該手書き資料の，物理的な状態を示す．
custEvent
custodial eventNo ja for "custodial event"
describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript. 手書き資料の管理履歴における，ひとつの事象を示す．
custodialHist
custodial historyNo ja for "custodial history"
contains a description of a manuscript's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events. 手書き資料の管理履歴を示す．散文形式または一連の日付つき履歴で示す．
decoDesc
decoration descriptionNo ja for "decoration description"
contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript, either as a sequence of paragraphs, or as a sequence of topically organised decoNote elements. 当該手書き資料の装飾を，一連の散文段落，または一連の要素 decoNoteで示す．
decoNote
note on decorationNo ja for "note on decoration"
contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript, or a fairly homogenous class of such components. 当該手書き資料の装飾要素またはそのようなものを示す．
depth
specifies a length measured across the spine. 冊子の背と平行した深さを示す．
dimensions
contains a dimensional specification. 大きさ・程度を示す．
 
 @type
indicates which aspect of the object is being measured. 当該計測対象を示す．
 
  leaves
dimensions relate to one or more leaves (e.g. a single leaf, a gathering, or a separately bound part) 葉の状態を示す．例えば，一葉，葉の丁合(折丁)，独立した一枚を まとめたもの，など．
  ruled
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been ruled in preparation for writing. 書記の準備として罫が引かれている領域を示す．
  pricked
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been pricked out in preparation for ruling (used where this differs significantly from the ruled area, or where the ruling is not measurable). 罫を引く準備として開けられた穴がある領域を示す．これは，罫付 き領域とも，罫が読み取れない領域とも異なる．
  written
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been written, with the height measured from the top of the minims on the top line of writing, to the bottom of the minims on the bottom line of writing. 書記領域を示す．先頭文字行から最終文字行までの高さ．
  miniatures
dimensions relate to the miniatures within the manuscript 当該手書き資料の彩飾図の大きさを示す．
  binding
dimensions relate to the binding in which the codex or manuscript is contained 冊子や写本全体の大きさを示す．
  box
dimensions relate to the box or other container in which the manuscript is stored. 当該写本を入れるケースの大きさを示す．
explicit
contains the explicit of a manuscript item, that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it. 手書き資料の巻末語句(explicit)を示す．すなわち，当該テ キストの終了を示す語句のことである．これは，朱書き部分(rubric)やコロ フォン(奥付情報)とは異なる．
filiation
contains information concerning the manuscript's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts of the same text, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs. 手書き資料の親子関係，すなわち，同じテキストを持つ現存 する手書き資料と，その原本(protographs), 異本(antigraphs), 転写本(apographs)との関係．
finalRubric
contains the string of words that denotes the end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, usually set off from the text itself by red ink, by a different size or type of script, or by some other such visual device. テキスト部分の終わりを示す文字列を示す．その著者やタイトルを含むこと がある．一般には，テキスト中にある朱書きや，大きさや種類の異なる字体 など，異なる視覚効果で示されている．
foliation
describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex. 冊子における葉やページを数える付番システムを示す．
handDesc
description of handsNo ja for "description of hands"
contains a description of all the different kinds of writing used in a manuscript. 手書き資料にある異なる書記全てについての解説を示す．
 
 @hands
specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript 当該手書き資料中で特定可能な筆致の数を示す．
height
contains a measurement measured along the axis parallel to the spine. 背に沿って計測された大きさを示す．
heraldry
contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon, coat of arms, etc. 紋章学的記述を含む．例えば，紋章記述や紋章など．
history
groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料の歴史を表す要素をまとめる．
incipit
contains the incipit of a manuscript item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipts were, in fomer times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title. 手書き資料の冒頭語句(incipit)を示す．冒頭語句とは，テキ ストの書き出しにある語句で，これに先行してある朱書き部分を除いた，当 該作品を特定するに充分な文量の部分である． 冒頭語句は，タイトル部分において，作品への参照を示す手段としてよく使 用されていた．
institution
contains the name of an organization such as a university or library, with which a manuscript is identified, generally its holding institution. 手書き資料を特定する，一般にはそれを所蔵する大学や図書館といった組織 の名前を示す．
layout
describes how text is laid out on the page, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques. 当該ページ上でテキストがどのようにレイアウトされているかを示す．例え ば，罫線，穴，などの書記支度技法．
 
 @columns
specifies the number of columns per page ページ中の段数を示す．
 @ruledLines
specifies the number of ruled lines per column 1段中の罫の数を示す．
 @writtenLines
specifies the number of written lines per colum 1段中の行数を示す．
layoutDesc
layout descriptionNo ja for "layout description"
collects the set of layout descriptions applicable to a manuscript. 手書き資料のレイアウト情報をまとめる．
locus
defines a location within a manuscript or manuscript part, usually as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references. 手書き資料中の場所を定義する．一般には，(多くの場合不連続の)一連の折 丁参照による．
 
 @scheme
identifies the foliation scheme in terms of which the location is being specified. 当該場所を指定するための折丁スキームを特定する．
 @from
specifies the starting point of the location in a normalized form. 正規化された形で，当該場所の始点を示す．
 @to
specifies the end-point of the location in a normalized form. 正規化された形で，当該場所の終点を示す．
 @target
supplies a link to one or more transcriptions of the specified range of folios. 折丁の特定範囲にある，ひとつ以上の画像または転記データへのリンク を示す．
material
contains a word or phrase describing the material of which a manuscript (or part of a manuscript) is composed. 手書き資料を構成する素材を表す語句を示す．
msContents
manuscript contentsNo ja for "manuscript contents"
describes the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items. 手書き資料の知的内容を，一連の段落または一連の構造化された手書き資料 項目として示す．
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this object. 当該テキストの種類を示す．
msDesc
manuscript descriptionNo ja for "manuscript description"
contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript. 単一の識別可能な手書き資料の解説を示す．
msIdentifier
manuscript identifierNo ja for "manuscript identifier"
contains the information required to identify the manuscript being described. 解説されている手書き資料を特定するために必要な情報を示す．
msItem
manuscript itemNo ja for "manuscript item"
describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料の知的内容の中に出現する，独立した作品または項目を示す．
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item 当該項目のテキストの種類を示す．
msItemStruct
structured manuscript itemNo ja for "structured manuscript item"
contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料の知的内容の中に出現する，独立した作品または項目の構造的解 説を示す．
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item 当該テキストの種類を示す．
msName
alternative name
contains any form of unstructured alternative name used for a manuscript, such as an ocellus nominum, or nickname. 手書き資料を示す構造化されていない別名の形式を示す．例えば， ocellus nominumなどの愛称など．
msPart
manuscript partNo ja for "manuscript part"
contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, now forming part of a composite manuscript. 元々は別のものであったものを，新しくひとつにまとめ直された手書き資料 の情報を示す．
musicNotation
contains description of type of musical notation. 記譜法の種類を示す．
objectDesc
contains a description of the physical components making up the object which is being described. 当該対象の物理的構成要素の解説を示す．
 
 @form
a short project-specific name identifying the physical form of the carrier, for example as a codex, roll, fragment, partial leaf, cutting etc. 当該キャリアの物理的な形を示す，プロジェクト固有の短い名前．例え ば，冊子，巻子，断片，切れ端など．
origDate
origin dateNo ja for "origin date"
contains any form of date, used to identify the date of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料が生まれた日付を特定するたための日付を示す．
origPlace
origin placeNo ja for "origin place"
contains any form of place name, used to identify the place of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料が生まれた場所を特定するための場所を示す．
origin
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript or manuscript part. 手書き資料の出自に関する解説や情報を示す．
physDesc
physical descriptionNo ja for "physical description"
contains a full physical description of a manuscript or manuscript part, optionally subdivided using more specialised elements from the model.physDescPart class. 手書き資料の物理的な解説を示す．選択的に，クラスmodel.physDescPartに ある要素に下位分解される．
provenance
contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript or manuscript part, after its creation but before its acquisition. 手書き資料を入手するまでの歴史に関する，特定可能なエピソードに関する 情報を示す．
recordHist
recorded historyNo ja for "recorded history"
provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript description itself. 元になった手書き資料の，元や改訂に関する情報を示す．
repository
contains the name of a repository within which manuscripts are stored, possibly forming part of an institution. 手書き資料が収められている収蔵館の名前を示す．恐らく，団体の名前の一 部である．
rubric
contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words through which a manuscript signals the beginning of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, usually in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.朱書き部分，すなわち，手書き資料の見出し部分のテキスト を示す．手書き資料中にあるあるテキスト部分の始点を示すもので，よく著 者やタイトルが記されている．テキストとは異なって示されており，一般に は赤いインクで書かれている．または，異なる大きさや種類の字体が使われ るなど，ある視覚効果が使われている．
seal
contains a description of one seal or similar attachment applied to a manuscript. 手書き資料にあるシールや付着物を示す．
 
 @contemporary
specifies whether or not the seal is contemporary with the item to which it is affixed 当該シールが，当該資料と同時代のものかを示す．
sealDesc
seal descriptionNo ja for "seal description"
describes the seals or other external items attached to a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct seal elements, possibly with additional decoNotes. 手書き資料に付属するシールや他の付着物について，一連の段落や，一連の 要素sealにより，可能であれば要素decoNoteと共に示す．
secFol
second folioNo ja for "second folio"
The word or words taken from a fixed point in a codex (typically the beginning of the second leaf) in order to provide a unique identifier for it. ユニークな識別子を示すために，冊子中の特定点にある単語を示す．
signatures
contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex. 冊子における葉または折丁の記号に関する情報を示す．
source
describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript description. 手書き資料にある，元資料に関する情報を示す．
stamp
contains a word or phrase describing a stamp or similar device. 印などにある語句を示す．
summary
contains a brief summary of the intellectual content of an item, provided by the cataloguer. カタログ作成者が提示した，いち項目の知的内容を簡単にまとめたものを示 す．
support
contains a description of the materials etc. which make up the physical support for the written part of a manuscript. 手書き資料でテキストが書かれている部分を作る物理的な素材に関する説明 を示す．
supportDesc
support descriptionNo ja for "support description"
groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript. 手書き資料のテキスト部分を作る物理的な素材を示す要素をまとめる．
 
 @material
a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support プロジェクトで定義した，素材を示す短い名前．
 
  paper
  parch
parchmentNo ja for "parchment"
  mixed
surrogates
contains information about any digital or photographic representations of the manuscript being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere. 手書き資料が電子化されたものまたは写真の表現に関する情報を示す．
textLang
text languageNo ja for "text language"
describes the languages and writing systems used by a manuscript (as opposed to its description, which is described in the langUsage element). 手書き資料中の言語や書記システムを示す．(要素langUsageにあ る情報と対位する)
 
 @mainLang
main languageNo ja for "main language"
supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the manuscript. 当該手書き資料中で主に使用される言語を特定するコードを示す．
 @otherLangs
other languagesNo ja for "other languages"
one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the manuscript. 当該手書き資料中で使用されている他の言語を特定する，ひとつ以上の コード．
watermark
contains a word or phrase describing a watermark or similar device. すかし模様などを表す語句を示す．
width
contains a measurement measured along the axis perpendicular to the spine. 背に対して直角に計測される計測値を示す．

11. [transcr] Transcription of primary sources

11.1. Attribute classes

att.coordinated
elements which can be positioned within a two dimensional coordinate system. 2次元座標システムによる，場所を示す要素．
 
 @ulx
gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における左上点のX軸の値を示す．
 @uly
gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における左上点のY軸の値を示す．
 @lrx
gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における右下点のX軸の値を示す．
 @lry
gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における右下点のY軸の値を示す．
att.global.facs
groups elements corresponding with all or part of an image, because they contain an alternative representation of it, typically but not necessarily a transcription of it. 要素facsimileに含まれる画像や紙面に関する要素．
 
 @facs
facsimileNo ja for "facsimile"
points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element. 当該要素に対応する要素facsimileにある画像やその部分への 参照．

11.2. Model classes

att.coordinated
elements which can be positioned within a two dimensional coordinate system. 2次元座標システムによる，場所を示す要素．
 
 @ulx
gives the x coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における左上点のX軸の値を示す．
 @uly
gives the y coordinate value for the upper left corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における左上点のY軸の値を示す．
 @lrx
gives the x coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における右下点のX軸の値を示す．
 @lry
gives the y coordinate value for the lower right corner of a rectangular space. 矩形における右下点のY軸の値を示す．
att.global.facs
groups elements corresponding with all or part of an image, because they contain an alternative representation of it, typically but not necessarily a transcription of it. 要素facsimileに含まれる画像や紙面に関する要素．
 
 @facs
facsimileNo ja for "facsimile"
points to all or part of an image which corresponds with the content of the element. 当該要素に対応する要素facsimileにある画像やその部分への 参照．

11.3. Elements

addSpan
added span of textNo ja for "added span of text"
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add). 著者，筆写者，注釈者，校正者の手による長めの追加テキストを挿入する始 点を示す(addも参照のこと)．
am
abbreviation markerNo ja for "abbreviation marker"
contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation. 当該省略形が，原形を省略またはそれに代わったことを示す文字列または記 号列．
damage
contains an area of damage to the text witness. 当該文献におけるテキストの損傷部分を示す．
damageSpan
damaged span of textNo ja for "damaged span of text"
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible. 読める程度の損傷がある，一連のテキストの始点を示す．
delSpan
deleted span of text
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector. 著者・筆写者・注釈者・校正者により，削除または削除として符号化または 余分なものまたは間違いとして示されている，長めのテキスト部分の始点を 示す．
ex
editorial expansion
contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation. 編集者や転記者が，省略形を元に戻した結果の文字列を示す．
facsimile
contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text. 転記または符号化されたテキストではなく，画像データ中にある，書記資料の 表現を示す．
fw
forme work
contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page. 版面の周りにある柱やノンブルを示す．
 
 @type
classifies the material encoded according to some useful typology. 符号化された当該部分を分類する．
 
  header
a running title at the top of the page 天にタイトル．
  footer
a running title at the bottom of the page 地にあるタイトル．
  pageNum
page numberNo ja for "page number"
a page number or foliation symbol ノンブル．
  lineNum
line numberNo ja for "line number"
a line number, either of prose or poetry 韻文・散文における行番号．
  sig
signatureNo ja for "signature"
a signature or gathering symbol 折丁記号．
  catch
catchwordNo ja for "catchword"
a catch-word 柱．
handNotes
contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts. 元資料にある特定可能な筆致を記録する，ひとつ以上の要素 handNoteを示す．
handShift
marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint. テキストにおける新しい筆致の始まり，または筆写者の仕事の開始を示す．
 
 @new
identifies the new hand. 当該新しい筆致を特定する．
 @resp
signifies the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the change of hand. 筆致の変化を特定した責任のある編集者や転記者を特定する．
restore
indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction. 編集者や著者による指示を覆し，以前の状態のテキストを復元することを示 す．
space
indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text. 元資料にある重要な空白の場所を示す．
 
 @dim
dimensionNo ja for "dimension"
indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical. 当該空白は，縦長か横長かを示す．
 
  horizontal
the space is horizontal. 当該空白は，横長．
  vertical
the space is vertical. 当該空白は，縦長．
 @resp
responsible partyNo ja for "responsible party"
indicates the individual responsible for identifying and measuring the space. 当該空白を特定し測った責任のある人物を示す．
subst
substitutionNo ja for "substitution"
groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text. 追加と削除が一連の調整と考えられる場合，そのひとつ以上の追加部分や削 除部分をまとめる．
supplied
signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original. 転記者や編集者にひょって付加されたテキストを示す．例えば，元のテキス トが物理的損傷や欠損から判読できない場合などに付加されるもの．
 
 @reason
indicates why the text has had to be supplied. 当該テキストが付加された理由を示す．
surface
defines a written surface in terms of a rectangular coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, and rectangular zones of interest within it. 矩形の座標により，書記の表面を定義する．選択的に，空間や矩形範囲中のひ とつ以上の図表表現をまとめる．
 
 @start
points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface. 刻字されたテキストの始点を表す要素を指示する．
zone
defines a rectangular area contained within a surface element. 要素surfaceにある表面上の矩形範囲を定義する．

12. [textcrit] Critical Apparatus

12.1. Attribute classes

att.rdgPart
attributes for elements which mark the beginning or ending of a fragmentary manuscript or other witness. 手書き資料や文献の断片について，その初めと終わりを示す要素向けの 属性．
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo ja for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses which begin or end at this point. ひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを含む． 当該ポインタにより文献記号で示された文献の始めまたは終わりが示さ れている．
att.textCritical
defines a set of attributes common to all elements representing variant readings in text critical work. 校勘資料における解釈を示す要素全てに付与される属性を定義する．
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo ja for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the witnesses which attest to a given reading. 当該解釈を証す文献を示す1つ以上のポインタのリストを示す．
 @type
classifies the reading according to some useful typology. 当該解釈の分類を示す．
 
  substantive
the reading offers a substantive variant. 当該解釈は，実質的な異形を示す．
  orthographic
the reading differs only orthographically, not in substance, from other readings. 当該解釈は，実質的なものではないが，他の解釈の正書法と異なる．
 @cause
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins. 解釈が異なる原因を分類する．
 
  homeoteleuton
  homeoarchy
  paleographicConfusion
  haplography
  dittography
  falseEmendation
 @varSeq
variant sequenceNo ja for "variant sequence"
provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants on any one lemma. 1つの対象語に対する一連の異形を想定する理由がある場合，当該解釈 がある場所を番号で示す．
 @resp
responsible partyNo ja for "responsible party"
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness. 当該文献にある特定の解釈に責任のある編集者を示す．
 @hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness. 当該文献における特定の解釈に責任を持つ筆致を示す．

12.2. Model classes

att.rdgPart
attributes for elements which mark the beginning or ending of a fragmentary manuscript or other witness. 手書き資料や文献の断片について，その初めと終わりを示す要素向けの 属性．
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo ja for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses which begin or end at this point. ひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを含む． 当該ポインタにより文献記号で示された文献の始めまたは終わりが示さ れている．
att.textCritical
defines a set of attributes common to all elements representing variant readings in text critical work. 校勘資料における解釈を示す要素全てに付与される属性を定義する．
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo ja for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the witnesses which attest to a given reading. 当該解釈を証す文献を示す1つ以上のポインタのリストを示す．
 @type
classifies the reading according to some useful typology. 当該解釈の分類を示す．
 
  substantive
the reading offers a substantive variant. 当該解釈は，実質的な異形を示す．
  orthographic
the reading differs only orthographically, not in substance, from other readings. 当該解釈は，実質的なものではないが，他の解釈の正書法と異なる．
 @cause
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins. 解釈が異なる原因を分類する．
 
  homeoteleuton
  homeoarchy
  paleographicConfusion
  haplography
  dittography
  falseEmendation
 @varSeq
variant sequenceNo ja for "variant sequence"
provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants on any one lemma. 1つの対象語に対する一連の異形を想定する理由がある場合，当該解釈 がある場所を番号で示す．
 @resp
responsible partyNo ja for "responsible party"
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness. 当該文献にある特定の解釈に責任のある編集者を示す．
 @hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness. 当該文献における特定の解釈に責任を持つ筆致を示す．

12.3. Elements

app
apparatus entry
contains one entry in a critical apparatus, with an optional lemma and at least one reading. 校勘資料中のいち対象で，内容として少なくとも1つの読みと，選択的に見 出し(lemma)をとる．
 
 @type
classifies the variation contained in this element according to some convenient typology. 当該要素で示される対象を分類する．
 @from
identifies the beginning of the lemma in the base text, if necessary. 必要であれば，元テキストにおける対象語(lemma)の開始点を示す．
 @to
identifies the endpoint of the lemma in the base text, if necessary. 必要であれば，元テキストにおける対象語(lemma)語の終点を示す．
 @loc
locationNo ja for "location"
indicates the location of the variation, when the location-referenced method of apparatus markup is used. 校勘資料で場所参照の手法が採られている場合，該当する異なりの場所 を示す．
lacunaEnd
indicates the end of a lacuna in a mostly complete textual witness. 殆ど完全である文献中にある脱文の終わりを示す．
lacunaStart
indicates the beginning of a lacuna in the text of a mostly complete textual witness. 殆ど完全である文献にある脱文の始めを示す．
lem
lemma
contains the lemma, or base text, of a textual variation. 異なるテキストにおける対象語，すなわち基底テキスト(base text)を示す．
listWit
witness list
lists definitions for all the witnesses referred to by a critical apparatus, optionally grouped hierarchically. 校勘資料中で参照されている文献の定義のリストを示す．選択的に，グルー プとして構造化されている．
rdg
reading
contains a single reading within a textual variation. 異なるテキスト中で，ひとつの読みを示す．
rdgGrp
reading groupNo ja for "reading group"
within a textual variation, groups two or more readings perceived to have a genetic relationship or other affinity. 異なるテキストで，系統関係や類縁性があるとされる，二つ以上の読みをま とめる．
variantEncoding
declares the method used to encode text-critical variants. 校勘対象を符号化する手法を示す．
 
 @method
indicates which method is used to encode the apparatus of variants. 異なる校勘資料を符号化する手法を示す．
 
  location-referenced
apparatus uses line numbers or other canonical reference scheme referenced in a base text. 校勘資料の基底テキスト中には，参照される行番号または標準的 な参照スキームがある．
  double-end-point
apparatus indicates the precise locations of the beginning and ending of each lemma relative to a base text. 校勘資料の基底テキスト上にある各校合部分の始点と終点の正確な 場所が示されている．
  parallel-segmentation
alternate readings of a passage are given in parallel in the text; no notion of a base text is necessary. ある一節の別の解釈が，当該テキスト中に併置されている．基底テ キストという視点は必要なくなる．
 @location
indicates whether the apparatus appears within the running text or external to it. 校合の情報が，本文中，または外部にあるかを示す．
 
  internal
apparatus appears within the running text. 校合の情報は，本文中にある．
  external
apparatus appears outside the base text. 校合の情報は，本文外，すなわち基底テキスト外にある．
wit
contains a list of one or more sigla of witnesses attesting a given reading, in a textual variation. 読みの元となる文献を表すひとつ以上の文献記号のリストを示す．
witDetail
witness detailNo ja for "witness detail"
gives further information about a particular witness, or witnesses, to a particular reading. 特定の解釈に関連する，特定の文献について詳細な情報を示す．
 
 @target
indicates the identifier for the reading, or readings, to which the witness detail refers. 当該文献細目が関連する解釈の識別子を示す．
 @resp
responsible partyNo ja for "responsible party"
identifies the individual responsible for identifying the witness 当該文献を特定する責任のある人物を示す．
 @wit
witnessesNo ja for "witnesses"
indicates the sigil or sigla for the witnesses to which the detail refers. 細目が参照する当該文献の印や文献記号を示す．
 @type
describes the type of information given about the witness. 当該文献に関する情報の種類を示す．
witEnd
fragmented witness endNo ja for "fragmented witness end"
indicates the end, or suspension, of the text of a fragmentary witness. 断片的な文献のテキストの終わりまたは停止点を示す．
witStart
fragmented witness startNo ja for "fragmented witness start"
indicates the beginning, or resumption, of the text of a fragmentary witness. 断片的な文献のテキストの始点または再開点を示す．
witness
contains either a description of a single witness referred to within the critical apparatus, or a list of witnesses which is to be referred to by a single sigil. 校勘資料で参照されている文献ひとつの情報，またはひとつの印が参照して いる文献のリストを示す．

13. [namesdates] Names and dates

13.1. Attribute classes

att.datable.iso
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the ISO 8601 standard. ISO8601に従い，時間事象の正規的方法を示す属性を示す．
 
 @when-iso
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form. 日付や時間を，標準形式で示す．
 @notBefore-iso
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd. 当該事象の一番古い日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
 @notAfter-iso
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd. 当該事象の一番新しい日付を，標準形式で示す．例えば，yyyy-mm-dd．
 @from-iso
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form. 当該時間幅の，始点を標準形で示す．
 @to-iso
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form. 当該時間幅の，終点を標準形で示す．
att.duration.iso
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations. 正規化された時間幅を記す属性．
 
 @dur-iso
durationNo ja for "duration"
indicates the length of this element in time. 当該時間の長さを示す．

 @notAfter-iso

13.3. Elements

addName
additional name
contains an additional name component, such as a nickname, epithet, or alias, or any other descriptive phrase used within a personal name. 付加的な名前要素を示す．例えば，愛称，渾名，別名などの個人名．
affiliation
contains an informal description of a person's present or past affiliation with some organization, for example an employer or sponsor. 人物が所属している，またはしていた団体に関する情報を示す．例えば，雇 い主や出資者など．
age
specifies the age of a person. 人物の年齢を示す．
 
 @value
supplies a numeric code representing the age or age group 年齢または年齢層を数値で示す．
birth
contains information about a person's birth, such as its date and place. 人物の出生に関する情報を示す．例えば，日時や場所など．
bloc
contains the name of a geo-political unit consisting of two or more nation states or countries. 複数の国や地域を跨ぐ地政学的な名前を示す．
climate
contains information about the physical climate of a place. ある場所の天候に関する情報を示す．
country
contains the name of a geo-political unit, such as a nation, country, colony, or commonwealth, larger than or administratively superior to a region and smaller than a bloc. 1つの国家に相当する地政学的な単位名を示す．国家，植民地，共同体・連 邦を含む．これは，行政単位上の地域よりも大きい単位で，連合より小さな 単位である．
death
contains information about a person's death, such as its date and place. 人物の死亡に関する情報を示す．例えば，日付や場所など．
district
contains the name of any kind of subdivision of a settlement, such as a parish, ward, or other administrative or geographic unit. 場所を示す要素として，集落より小さい名前を示す．例えば，小教区や区な ど，行政上・地勢上の単位．
education
contains a description of the educational experience of a person. 人物の学歴を示す．
event
contains data relating to any kind of significant event associated with a person, place, or organization. 人生における特定の重要事象の解説を示す．
 
 @where
indicates the location of an event by pointing to a place elementNo ja for "indicates the location of an event by pointing to a place element"
faith
specifies the faith, religion, or belief set of a person. 人物の信仰・宗教を示す．
floruit
contains information about a person's period of activity. 人物が活躍した時期に関する情報を示す．
forename
contains a forename, given or baptismal name. 人物に与えられた名前のうち，名の部分，すなわち個人を表す部分を示す．
genName
generational name componentNo ja for "generational name component"
contains a name component used to distinguish otherwise similar names on the basis of the relative ages or generations of the persons named. 似た名前を区別する為に，相対的な年齢関係，世代関係などの情報を示す．
geo
geographical coordinatesNo ja for "geographical coordinates"
contains any expression of a set of geographic coordinates, representing a point, line, or area on the surface of the earth in some notation. 地球上の一点，線，領域を表すための，地理上の座標を示す．
geogFeat
geographical feature name
contains a common noun identifying some geographical feature contained within a geographic name, such as valley, mount, etc. 地理上の名前，例えば，谷，山などに含まれている地物を特定する名前を示 す．
geogName
geographical name
a name associated with some geographical feature such as Windrush Valley or Mount Sinai. ウィンドラッシュ峡谷，シナイ山などの地理的特性に関する名前．
 
 @type
provides more culture- linguistic- or application- specific information used to categorize this name component. 当該名前を分類するための，文化的，言語的，ソフトウェア依存の情報 を示す．
langKnowledge
language knowledgeNo ja for "language knowledge"
summarizes the state of a person's linguistic knowledge, either as prose or by a list of langKnown elements. 個人の言語学的知識を散文または要素langKnownのリストでまとめ る．
 
 @tags
supplies one or more valid language tags for the languages specified ひとつ以上の言語を示す．
langKnown
language known
summarizes the state of a person's linguistic competence, i.e., knowledge of a single language. 個人の言語能力を示す．すなわち，単一言語の知識を示す．
 
 @tag

 @level
a code indicating the person's level of knowledge for this language 個人レベルの知識を示す言語コード．
listNym

contains a list of nyms, that is, standardized names for any thing. 別名，すなわち，一般的に使われている名前のリストを示す．
listOrg
list of organizationsNo ja for "list of organizations"
contains a list of elements, each of which provides information about an identifiable organization. 特定可能な団体に関する情報を示す解説のリストを示す．
listPerson
list of personsNo ja for "list of persons"
contains a list of descriptions, each of which provides information about an identifiable person or a group of people, for example the participants in a language interaction, or the people referred to in a historical source. 特定可能な個人やグループに関する情報のリストを示す．例えば，言語交流 の参加者や，歴史資料中で参照される人物など．
listPlace
list of placesNo ja for "list of places"
contains a list of places, optionally followed by a list of relationships (other than containment) defined amongst them. 場所のリストを示す．選択的に，場所間の(包含関係ではなく)関連性を 示すリストが続く．
location
defines the location of a place as a set of geographical coordinates, in terms of a other named geo-political entities, or as an address. 地理上の座標集合，地政学上の名前付き実体，アドレスなどにより場所を定 義する．
nameLink
contains a connecting phrase or link used within a name but not regarded as part of it, such as van der or of. 名前の中で使われているが，その一部としては見られない，関連する句やリ ンクを示す．例えば，van derや ofなど．
nationality
contains an informal description of a person's present or past nationality or citizenship. 人物の国籍や市民権の形式的でない解説を示す．
nym
canonical nameNo ja for "canonical name"
contains the definition for a canonical name or namepart of any kind. 各種名前の，標準的な名前または名前の部分の定義を示す．
 
 @parts
points to constituent nyms 構成別名を参照する．
occupation
contains an informal description of a person's trade, profession or occupation. 人物の仕事や職業の，形式的でない説明を示す．
 
 @scheme
identifies the classification system or taxonomy in use by supplying the identifier of a taxonomy element elsewhere in the header. ヘダー内にある要素taxonomyの識別子により，使われている 分類システムを示す．
 @code
identifies an occupation code defined within the classification system or taxonomy defined by the scheme attribute. 属性schemeで定義されている分類システムの中で定義され る仕事コードを示す．
offset
that part of a relative temporal or spatial expression which indicates the direction of the offset between the two place names, dates, or times involved in the expression. 当該表現に含まれている2つの場所名，日付，時間のオフセットの方向を示 す，相対的な時空表現の部分を示す．
org
organizationNo ja for "organization"
provides information about an identifiable organization such as a business, a tribe, or any other grouping of people. 特定可能な団体の情報を示す．例えば，会社，集団など，人の集まり．
 
 @role

orgName

persName

person
provides information about an identifiable individual, for example a participant in a language interaction, or a person referred to in a historical source. 特定可能な個人の情報を示す．例えば，言語交流の参加者，歴史資料中で参 照される人物など．

 @sex

region
contains the name of an administrative unit such as a state, province, or county, larger than a settlement, but smaller than a country. 行政上の単位の名前を示す．例えば，地方，郡，居住地など．居住地よりも 広く，国家より狭い地域．
relation
relationship
describes any kind of relationship or linkage amongst a specified group of participants. 指定された参加者グループ間の関連性の種類を示す．
 
 @type
categorizes the relationship in some respect, e.g. as social, personal or other. 当該関係を分類する．例えば，社会的関係，個人的関係など．
 
  social

  personal

 @mutual

 @code

trait
