14. [figures] Tables, formulæ, and figures

14.1. Elements

cell
contains one cell of a table. 表中のひとつのセルを示す．
figDesc
description of figure
contains a brief prose description of the appearance or content of a graphic figure, for use when documenting an image without displaying it. 図表の内容や現れ方について簡単な散文で解説を示す．当該図表を示さない で記録する場合に使用される．
figure
groups elements representing or containing graphic information such as an illustration or figure. 図表を示すまたは含む要素をまとめる．
formula
contains a mathematical or other formula. 数式を示す．
 
 @notation
supplies the name of a previously defined notation used for the content of the element. 当該要素の内容にある既定表記法の名前を示す．
row
contains one row of a table. 表の1行を示す．
table
contains text displayed in tabular form, in rows and columns. 表形式で示されるテキストを，行と列で示す．
 
 @rows
indicates the number of rows in the table. 当該表中の行数を示す．
 @cols
columnsNo ja for "columns"
indicates the number of columns in each row of the table. 当該表中の列数を示す．

15. [corpus] Corpus texts

15.1. Elements

activity
contains a brief informal description of what a participant in a language interaction is doing other than speaking, if anything. 言語交流の参加者が行った発話以外の活動を示す．
channel
primary channel
describes the medium or channel by which a text is delivered or experienced. For a written text, this might be print, manuscript, e-mail, etc.; for a spoken one, radio, telephone, face-to-face, etc. テキストが収録・伝搬されている媒体を示す．例えば，書かれてあるテキス トであれば，印刷本，原稿，eメールなどで，発話されたテキストであれば， ラジオ，電話，直接会話など．
 
 @mode
specifies the mode of this channel with respect to speech and writing. 発話や書記の伝搬経路の種類を示す．
 
  s
spoken
  w
written
  sw
spoken to be written
e.g. dictation 発話されたものを書いたもの．例えば書き起こしなど．
  ws
written to be spoken
e.g. a script 書かれたものを発話したもの．例えば，台本など．
  m
mixed
  x
unknown or inapplicable
constitution
describes the internal composition of a text or text sample, for example as fragmentary, complete, etc. テキストの内部構造を示す．例えば，部分的，完全など．
 
 @type
specifies how the text was constituted. 当該テキストの構成状況を示す．
 
  single
a single complete text 完全な1つのテキスト．
  composite
a text made by combining several smaller items, each individually complete 個々に完全である幾つかのテキストを部分テキストとして構成され ているテキスト．
  frags
fragmentsNo ja for "fragments"
a text made by combining several smaller, not necessarily complete, items 個々には完全である必要はない幾つかのテキストから構成されてい るテキスト．
  unknown
composition unknown or unspecified 構成状況は不明または不定．
derivation
describes the nature and extent of originality of this text. 当該テキストの真性度を示す．
 
 @type
categorizes the derivation of the text. 当該テキストの起源の分類を示す．
 
  original
text is original 当該テキストはオリジナルである．
  revision
text is a revision of some other text 当該テキストは，他のテキストを元にした改訂である．
  translation
text is a translation of some other text 当該テキストは，他のテキストを翻訳したものである．
  abridgment
text is an abridged version of some other text 当該テキストは，他のテキストを簡約したものである．
  plagiarism
text is plagiarized from some other text 当該テキストは，他のテキストを剽窃したものである．
  traditional
text has no obvious source but is one of a number derived from some common ancestor 当該テキストは，元資料が不明であるが，何かしらを元にたテキス トである．
domain
domain of use
describes the most important social context in which the text was realized or for which it is intended, for example private vs. public, education, religion, etc. 当該テキストの出現に関する最も重要な社会的状況を示す．例えば，私的， 公的，教育上，宗教上など．
 
 @type
categorizes the domain of use. 当該社会的状況の分類を示す．
 
  art
art and entertainment 芸術，娯楽．
  domestic
domestic and private 家庭内，私的．
  religious
religious and ceremonial 宗教，儀式．
  business
business and work place 仕事，職場．
  education
education 教育．
  govt
governmentNo ja for "government"
government and law 政府，法律．
  public
other forms of public context その他の公的なもの．
factuality
describes the extent to which the text may be regarded as imaginative or non-imaginative, that is, as describing a fictional or a non-fictional world. 当該テキストの現実度を示す．例えば，フィクション，ノンフィクションなど．
 
 @type
categorizes the factuality of the text. 当該現実度の分類を示す．
 
  fiction
the text is to be regarded as entirely imaginative 当該テキストは，想像の産物である．
  fact
the text is to be regarded as entirely informative or factual 当該テキストは，事実的なものである．
  mixed
the text contains a mixture of fact and fiction 当該テキストは，フィクション，ノンフィクションが混在している．
  inapplicable
the fiction/fact distinction is not regarded as helpful or appropriate to this text フィクション，ノンフィクションの区別は問題にならない．
interaction
describes the extent, cardinality and nature of any interaction among those producing and experiencing the text, for example in the form of response or interjection, commentary, etc. 当該テキストの生成に関わった人たちによる相互作用の程度，濃度，性質を 示す．例えば，応答，合いの手，コメントなど．
 
 @type
specifies the degree of interaction between active and passive participants in the text. 当該テキストにおける参加者間の相互作用の程度を示す．
 
  none
no interaction of any kind, e.g. a monologue 相互作用ではない．例えば，独白など．
  partial
some degree of interaction, e.g. a monologue with set responses ある程度の相互作用．例えば，反応する人がいる状況での独白など．
  complete
complete interaction, e.g. a face to face conversation 完全なる相互作用．例えば，直接対話など．
  inapplicable
this parameter is inappropriate or inapplicable in this case 当該パラメータは，不適切，または使用が相応しくない．
 @active
specifies the number of active participants (or addressors) producing parts of the text. 当該テキストの生成に関わる能動的参加者の人数を示す．
 
  singular
a single addressor 個人の参加者．
  plural
many addressors 複数の参加者．
  corporate
a corporate addressor 団体としての参加者．
  unknown
number of addressors unknown or unspecifiable 参加者は不明または特定不可能．
 @passive
specifies the number of passive participants (or addressees) to whom a text is directed or in whose presence it is created or performed. 当該テキストの生成に関わる受動的参加者の人数を示す．
 
  self
text is addressed to the originator e.g. a diary テキストは作成者に向けられたもの．例えば，日記など．
  single
text is addressed to one other person e.g. a personal letter テキストは他の人物に向けられたもの．例えば，個人書簡など．
  many
text is addressed to a countable number of others e.g. a conversation in which all participants are identified テキストは可算のその他のもの．例えば，全参加者が特定できる会 話など．
  group
text is addressed to an undefined but fixed number of participants e.g. a lecture テキストは人数が特定数である参加者に向けられたもの．例えば， 講義など．
  world
text is addressed to an undefined and indeterminately large number e.g. a published book テキストは，その規模が判らない程の多数に向けられたもの．例え ば，出版書籍など．
locale
contains a brief informal description of the kind of place concerned, for example: a room, a restaurant, a park bench, etc. 場所の性質を表す簡単な情報を示す．例えば，部屋，レストラン，公園のベ ンチなど．
particDesc
participation description
describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction. 言語交流における，特定可能な発話者，声，その他の参加者を示す．
preparedness
describes the extent to which a text may be regarded as prepared or spontaneous. テキストが準備されたものか，即興的なものかの程度を示す．
 
 @type
a keyword characterizing the type of preparedness. 即興度の種類を示すキーワード．
 
  none
spontaneous or unprepared 即興または準備されていない．
  scripted
follows a script 台本に従う．
  formulaic
follows a predefined set of conventions 事前の打ち合わせに従う．
  revised
polished or revised before presentation 事前の準備が練り直しまたは修正されている．
purpose
characterizes a single purpose or communicative function of the text. 当該テキストの目的や伝達に関する機能の性質を示す．
 
 @type
specifies a particular kind of purpose. 目的の種類を示す．
 
  persuade
didactic, advertising, propaganda, etc. 教育，広報，宣伝など．
  express
self expression, confessional, etc. 自己表現，独白など．
  inform
convey information, educate, etc. 情報伝達，教育など．
  entertain
amuse, entertain, etc. 娯楽，エンターテイメントなど．
 @degree
specifies the extent to which this purpose predominates. 当該目的が及ぶ範囲を示す．
setting
describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place. 言語交流が行われたひとつの状況設定を示す．
settingDesc
setting description
describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, either as a prose description or as a series of setting elements. 言語交流が行われた状況設定を，散文または一連の要素settingに より示す．
textDesc
text descriptionNo ja for "text description"
provides a description of a text in terms of its situational parameters. 状況パラメータにより，テキストの情報を示す．

16. [linking] Linking, segmentation and alignment

16.1. Attribute classes

att.global.linking
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected. リンクに関する付加的タグが使用される場合，全ての要素に付与可能な，リ ンクやハイパーテキストのための属性を定義する．
 
 @corresp
correspondsNo ja for "corresponds"
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way. 当該要素と対応する要素を示す．
 @synch
synchronousNo ja for "synchronous"
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element. 当該要素と連動する要素を示す．
 @sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element. 当該要素と同一の要素を示す．
 @copyOf
points to an element of which the current element is a copy. 当該要素のコピー要素を示す．
 @next
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part. 当該要素も所属する仮想集合における次の要素を示す．
 @prev
previousNo ja for "previous"
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part. 当該要素も所属する仮想集合における前の要素を示す．
 @exclude
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element. 当該要素の代替要素を示す．
 @select
selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected. ひとつ以上の選択肢を選ぶ．ひとつの選択肢が選ばれる場合，その曖昧 度や不確実度が示される．複数の選択肢が選ばれる場合，選ばれなかっ た選択肢の数から還元される，曖昧度や不確実度が示される．
att.pointing
defines a set of attributes used by all elements which point to other elements by means of one or more URI references. URIにより要素を参照する要素に共通して付与される属性を定義する．
 
 @type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories. 当該ポインタの種類を示す．
 @evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer. 当該ポインタの参照先がポインタである場合，その意図を示す．
 
  all
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer. 参照先の要素がポインターである場合，そのポインターの参照先へ と展開する．これを，参照先がポインターでなくなるまで続ける．
  one
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer. 参照先の要素がポインターである場合，(そのポインターの参照先 がどうであれ)そのポインターが参照先になる．
  none
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target. 当該ポインターの参照先から先にあるリンクへの展開は行わない．
att.pointing.group
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements. ポインタとなる要素に共通の属性を示す．
 
 @domains
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie. 当該要素の中にある全要素を対象とした識別子を選択的に指定する．
 @targFunc
target functionNo ja for "target function"
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags. 要素link, join, altに付与された属性 targetsの値の機能を示す．

16.2. Model classes

att.global.linking
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected. リンクに関する付加的タグが使用される場合，全ての要素に付与可能な，リ ンクやハイパーテキストのための属性を定義する．
 
 @corresp
correspondsNo ja for "corresponds"
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way. 当該要素と対応する要素を示す．
 @synch
synchronousNo ja for "synchronous"
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element. 当該要素と連動する要素を示す．
 @sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element. 当該要素と同一の要素を示す．
 @copyOf
points to an element of which the current element is a copy. 当該要素のコピー要素を示す．
 @next
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part. 当該要素も所属する仮想集合における次の要素を示す．
 @prev
previousNo ja for "previous"
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part. 当該要素も所属する仮想集合における前の要素を示す．
 @exclude
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element. 当該要素の代替要素を示す．
 @select
selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected. ひとつ以上の選択肢を選ぶ．ひとつの選択肢が選ばれる場合，その曖昧 度や不確実度が示される．複数の選択肢が選ばれる場合，選ばれなかっ た選択肢の数から還元される，曖昧度や不確実度が示される．
att.pointing
defines a set of attributes used by all elements which point to other elements by means of one or more URI references. URIにより要素を参照する要素に共通して付与される属性を定義する．
 
 @type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories. 当該ポインタの種類を示す．
 @evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer. 当該ポインタの参照先がポインタである場合，その意図を示す．
 
  all
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer. 参照先の要素がポインターである場合，そのポインターの参照先へ と展開する．これを，参照先がポインターでなくなるまで続ける．
  one
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer. 参照先の要素がポインターである場合，(そのポインターの参照先 がどうであれ)そのポインターが参照先になる．
  none
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target. 当該ポインターの参照先から先にあるリンクへの展開は行わない．
att.pointing.group
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements. ポインタとなる要素に共通の属性を示す．
 
 @domains
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie. 当該要素の中にある全要素を対象とした識別子を選択的に指定する．
 @targFunc
target functionNo ja for "target function"
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags. 要素link, join, altに付与された属性 targetsの値の機能を示す．

16.3. Elements

ab
anonymous block
contains any arbitrary component-level unit of text, acting as an anonymous container for phrase or inter level elements analogous to, but without the semantic baggage of, a paragraph. 任意の部分的テキスト単位を示す．特定の意味はなくとも，段落に相当する， 句レベル・挿入レベルの単位として無名単位になる．
 
 @part
specifies whether or not the block is complete. 当該部分の完全性を示す．
 
  Y
yesNo ja for "yes"
the block is incomplete 当該部分は完全ででない．
  N
noNo ja for "no"
either the block is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness 当該部分は完全である，または完全性が問題にならない．
  I
initialNo ja for "initial"
the initial part of an incomplete block 当該部分の，前部分が完全ではない．
  M
medialNo ja for "medial"
a medial part of an incomplete block 当該部分の，中部分が完全ではない．
  F
finalNo ja for "final"
the final part of an incomplete block 当該部分の，後部分が完全ではない．
alt
alternation
identifies an alternation or a set of choices among elements or passages. 要素などが選択的である場合のいち選択肢を示す．
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the alternative elements or passages. 当該選択肢の識別子を示す．
 @mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive. 示された選択肢の選択度を示す．
 
  excl
exclusiveNo ja for "exclusive"
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs. 高々ひとつしか選択できない．
  incl
inclusiveNo ja for "inclusive"
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur. 複数を選択できる．
 @weights
If mode is excl, each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs. If mode is incl each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs given that at least one of the other alternatives occurs. 属性modeの値がexclの場合，該当する選択肢 の出現度を示す． 属性modeの値がinclの場合，該当する選択肢の 少なくとも1つが出現する場合の出現度を示す．
altGrp
alternation group
groups a collection of alt elements and possibly pointers. 要素altまたはポインタ要素ptrをまとめる．
 
 @mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive. 当該要素でまとめられたものの，選択度を示す．
 
  excl
exclusiveNo ja for "exclusive"
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs. 高々ひとつしか選択できない．
  incl
inclusiveNo ja for "inclusive"
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur. 複数を選択できる．
anchor
anchor point
attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element. テキスト要素であるかどうかに関係なく，テキスト中で，参照先になるIDを 示す．
join
identifies a possibly fragmented segment of text, by pointing at the possibly discontiguous elements which compose it. バラバラにあるテキスト部分を参照し，ひとつのテキスト部分を指定する．
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be joined into a virtual element. 仮想要素へとまとめられる要素または一節の識別子を示す．
 @result
specifies the name of an element which this aggregation may be understood to represent. 当該要素によりまとめられる要素名を示す．
 @scope
indicates whether the targets to be joined include the entire element indicated (the entire subtree including its root), or just the children of the target (the branches of the subtree). まとめられる対象が，要素全体(すなわち当該要素をルートとする部分 木全体)，またはその子要素(すなわち部分木の枝)であるかどうかを示 す．
 
  root
the rooted subtrees indicated by the targets attribute are joined, each subtree become a child of the virtual element created by the join 属性で示された根付き部分木がまとめられ，各部分木は，当該要素 で作られた仮想要素の子となる．
  branches
the children of the subtrees indicated by the targets attribute become the children of the virtual element (i.e. the roots of the subtrees are discarded) 属性で示された部分木の子は，仮想要素の子となる(すなわち，当 該部分木の根は捨てられる．
joinGrp
join group
groups a collection of join elements and possibly pointers. 要素joinやポインタをまとめる．
 
 @result
describes the result of the joins gathered in this collection. 当該要素でまとめられた要素joinを示す．
link
defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements. 他の要素では上手く示せない，要素や一節間にある関連性やハイパーテキス トリンクを定義する．
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be linked or associated. リンク付けされれている当該要素または一節の識別子を示す．
linkGrp
link groupNo ja for "link group"
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links. 関連性やハイパーテキストリンクの集合を定義する．
seg
arbitrary segment
represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level. 任意の句レベルのテキスト単位を示す(要素segを含む)．
 
 @subtype
provides a sub-categorization of the segment marked. 符号化された部分の下位範疇を示す．
timeline
timeline
provides a set of ordered points in time which can be linked to elements of a spoken text to create a temporal alignment of that text. 時間的なまとまりを示すために，発話テキストの要素をリンクすることがで きる，時間軸上の順序付き時点の集合を示す．
 
 @origin
designates the origin of the timeline, i.e. the time at which it begins. 時間軸の起点示す．すなわち，始点の時間．
 @unit
specifies the unit of time corresponding to the interval value of the timeline or of its constituent points in time. 時間軸を構成する属性intervalの値に対応する，時間単位 を特定する．
 
  d
daysNo ja for "days"
  h
hoursNo ja for "hours"
  min
minutesNo ja for "minutes"
  s
secondsNo ja for "seconds"
  ms
millisecondsNo ja for "milliseconds"
 @interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval 間隔を表す数値を示す．
when
indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely. 同じ要素timeline中にある他の要素に対応する時点，または絶対 的な時点を示す．
 
 @absolute
supplies an absolute value for the time. 当該時点の，絶対時間を示す．
 @unit
specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeline. 親要素timeLineから継承されない場合，属性 intervalで示される時間の単位を示す．
 
  d
daysNo ja for "days"
  h
hoursNo ja for "hours"
  min
minutesNo ja for "minutes"
  s
secondsNo ja for "seconds"
  ms
millisecondsNo ja for "milliseconds"
 @interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval 時間幅を数値で示す．
 @since
identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point. 当該要素whenの時間となる参照時点を示す．参照時点に時間 幅を足すことで得られる．

17. [analysis] Simple analytic mechanisms

17.1. Attribute classes

att.global.analytic
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text. 任意のテキスト部分への分析・解釈に関連するグローバル属性を示す．
 
 @ana
analysisNo ja for "analysis"
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears. 属性anaを伴う要素の解釈を含む要素を示す．

17.2. Model classes

att.global.analytic
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text. 任意のテキスト部分への分析・解釈に関連するグローバル属性を示す．
 
 @ana
analysisNo ja for "analysis"
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears. 属性anaを伴う要素の解釈を含む要素を示す．

17.3. Elements

c
characterNo ja for "character"
represents a character. 文字を示す．
cl
clauseNo ja for "clause"
represents a grammatical clause. 言語学上の節を示す．
interp
interpretation
summarizes a specific interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text. あるテキスト部分とリンクする，特定の解釈的注釈をまとめる．
interpGrp
interpretation group
collects together a set of related interpretations which share responsibility or type. 責任者や分類を共にする，関連し合う解釈をまとめる．
m
morphemeNo ja for "morpheme"
represents a grammatical morpheme. 言語学上の形態素を示す．
 
 @baseForm
identifies the morpheme's base form. 形態素の基形を示す．
phr
phraseNo ja for "phrase"
represents a grammatical phrase. 文法上の句を示す．
s
s-unitNo ja for "s-unit"
contains a sentence-like division of a text. 文に相当するテキスト単位を示す．
span
associates an interpretative annotation directly with a span of text. テキスト部分に解釈的注釈を関連づける．
 
 @from
specifies the beginning of the passage being annotated; if not accompanied by a to attribute, then specifies the entire passage. 当該注釈対象の始点を示す．属性toがない場合は，対象全 体を示す．
 @to
specifies the end of the passage being annotated. 注釈対象の終点を示す．
spanGrp
span group
collects together span tags. 要素spanをまとめる．
w
wordNo ja for "word"
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word. 文法上の語を示す(正書形である必要はない)．
 
 @lemma
provides a lemma for the word, such as an uninflected dictionary entry form. 当該語の，辞書の見出し形を示す．
 @lemmaRef
provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form.No ja for "provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form."

18. [iso-fs] Feature structures

18.1. Elements

bicond
bi-conditional feature-structure constraint
defines a biconditional feature-structure constraint; both consequent and antecedent are specified as feature structures or groups of feature structures; the constraint is satisfied if both subsume a given feature structure, or if both do not. 素性構造の制約を必要十分条件として定義する．前提部と帰結部は，素性構 造またはそのグループとして定義される．当該制約は，与えられた2つの素 性構造が共に真であるか，またはともに偽である場合に，真になる．
binary
binary value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which can contain either of exactly two possible values. 二値として，素性値を示す．
 
 @value
supplies a binary value. 二値で値を示す．
cond
conditional feature-structure constraint
defines a conditional feature-structure constraint; the consequent and the antecedent are specified as feature structures or feature-structure collections; the constraint is satisfied if both the antecedent and the consequent subsume a given feature structure, or if the antecedent does not. 素性構造の条件制約を定義する．前提部と帰結部は，素性構造として定義さ れている．前提部と帰結部が共に真であったとき，または前提部が偽であっ たときに，当該条件節は真となる．
default
default feature valueNo ja for "default feature value"
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a defaulted value. 素性値定義の既定値を示す
f
feature
represents a feature value specification, that is, the association of a name with a value of any of several different types. 素性値定義を示す．すなわち，素性名とその様々な値を示す．
 
 @name
provides a name for the feature. 当該素性の名前を示す．
 @fVal
feature valueNo ja for "feature value"
references any element which can be used to represent the value of a feature. 素性値を表す要素を参照する．
fDecl
feature declaration
declares a single feature, specifying its name, organization, range of allowed values, and optionally its default value. ひとつの素性を宣言する．名前，構造，定義域，デフォルト値など．
 
 @name
indicates the name of the feature being declared; matches the name attribute of f elements in the text. 素性の名前を示す．要素fの属性nameと一致する もの．
 @optional
indicates whether or not the value of this feature may be present. 当該素性値があるかどうかを示す．
fDescr
feature description (in FSD)
describes in prose what is represented by the feature being declared and its values. 当該素性により示されるものを，散文で示す．
fLib
feature library
assembles a library of feature elements. 素性に関する要素のライブラリをまとめる．
fs
feature structure
represents a feature structure, that is, a collection of feature-value pairs organized as a structural unit.素性構造を示す．すなわち，構造単位となる素性名-素性値の 組の集合．
 
 @type
specifies the type of the feature structure. 当該素性構造の種類を示す．
 @feats
featuresNo ja for "features"
references the feature-value specifications making up this feature structure. 当該素性構造を構成する素性定義を参照する．
fsConstraints
feature-structure constraints
specifies constraints on the content of valid feature structures. 妥当な素性構造の内容に課す制約を示す．
fsDecl
feature structure declaration
declares one type of feature structure. ひとつの素性構造を宣言する．
 
 @type
gives a name for the type of feature structure being declared. 宣言された素性構造の名前を示す．
 @baseTypes
gives the name of one or more typed feature structures from which this type inherits feature specifications and constraints; if this type includes a feature specification with the same name as that of any of those specified by this attribute, or if more than one specification of the same name is inherited, then the set of possible values is defined by unification. Similarly, the set of constraints applicable is derived by combining those specified explicitly within this element with those implied by the baseTypes attribute. When no baseTypes attribute is specified, no feature specification or constraint is inherited. ひとつ以上の素性構造を示す．ここから，属性typeは素性定義・制約を 継承する．属性typeが当該属性で示されたものと同名の素性定義を含む 場合，またはひとつ以上の同名素性定義を継承する場合，それらの値は 統合される．同様に，当該属性baseTypesにある値と，当該 要素が持つ内容を統合して制約となる．属性baseTypeが付 与されていない場合，継承される素性定義や素性制約はない．
fsDescr
feature system description (in FSD)
describes in prose what is represented by the type of feature structure declared in the enclosing fsDecl. 要素fsDeclで定義される素性構造の内容を，散文で示す．
fsdDecl
feature system declarationNo ja for "feature system declaration"
provides a feature system declaration comprising one or more feature structure declarations or feature structure declaration links. ひとつ以上の素性構造宣言または素性構造宣言へのリンクを含む，素性シス テム宣言を示す．
fsdLink
feature structure declaration linkNo ja for "feature structure declaration link"
associates the name of a typed feature structure with a feature structure declaration for it. 素性構造宣言により素性構造の名前を示す．
 
 @type
identifies the type of feature structure to be documented; this will be the value of the type attribute on at least one feature structure. 解説される素性構造を示す．少なくともひとつの素性構造に関する属性 typeの値が付与される．
 @target
supplies a pointer to a feature structure declaration (fsDecl) element within the current document or elsewhere. 素性構造宣言要素(fsDecl)へのポインタが示される．
fvLib
feature-value library
assembles a library of reusable feature value elements (including complete feature structures). 再利用が可能な素性値をライブラリとしてまとめる．
if
defines a conditional default value for a feature; the condition is specified as a feature structure, and is met if it subsumes the feature structure in the text for which a default value is sought. 素性の条件におけるデフォルト値を定義する．当該値には，素性構造が指定 される．
iff
if and only ifNo ja for "if and only if"
separates the condition from the consequence in a bicond element. 必要十分条件における前提部と帰結部の区切を示す．
numeric
numeric value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a numeric value or range. 素性値定義における値を示す．
 
 @value
supplies a lower bound for the numeric value represented, and also (if max is not supplied) its upper bound. 与えられている数値の下限を示す．または，(属性maxが付 与されていない場合には)値の上限を示す．
 @max
supplies an upper bound for the numeric value represented. 与えられている数値の上限を示す．
 @trunc
specifies whether the value represented should be truncated to give an integer value. 当該数値が整数値へ丸められるかどうかを示す．
string
string value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a string. 素性値規定において，値として文字列をとる値の部分を示す．
symbol
symbolic value
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains one of a finite list of symbols. 記号リスト中のいち項目を含む素性値規定のうち，値の部分を示す．
 
 @value
supplies the symbolic value for the feature, one of a finite list that may be specified in a feature declaration. 当該組成の記号値を示す．素性宣言のリスト中にあるいち項目になる．
then
separates the condition from the default in an if, or the antecedent and the consequent in a cond element. 要素if中のデフォルト値と条件部，または要素cond中の 前提部と帰結部を区切る．
vAlt
value alternation
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a set of values, only one of which can be valid. 素性値規定において，妥当なひとつの値を表す，値の部分を示す．
vColl
collection of values
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains multiple values organized as a set, bag, or list. 素性値規定において，複数の値を，集合，バック，リストなどで表す，値の 部分を示す．
 
 @org
organizationNo ja for "organization"
indicates organization of given value or values as set, bag or list. 付与された値，または，集合，バッグ，リストとしてある値の構造を示 す．
 
  set
indicates that the given values are organized as a set. 集合(順序なし，重複なし)としてある値を示す．
  bag
indicates that the given values are organized as a bag (multiset). バック(順序なし，重複あり)としてある値を示す．
  list
indicates that the given values are organized as a list. リスト(順序あり，重複あり)としてある値を示す．
vDefault
value default
declares the default value to be supplied when a feature structure does not contain an instance of f for this name; if unconditional, it is specified as one (or, depending on the value of the org attribute of the enclosing fDecl) more fs elements or primitive values; if conditional, it is specified as one or more if elements; if no default is specified, or no condition matches, the value none is assumed. 素性構造が要素fを持たないときのデフォルト値を宣言する．条件 的でない場合，要素fsまたは値がもうひとつ(または，要素 fDeclにある属性orgの値に依存する数だけ)付与される．条件的な 場合，要素であればひとつ以上が付与される．デフォルト値が指定されてい ない場合，または条件が成立しない場合は，値noneをとるする．
vLabel
value label
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which appears at more than one point in a feature structure. 素性構造中，複数箇所に現れる，素性値規定の値の部分を示す．
 
 @name
supplies a name for the sharing point. 共有ポイントの場所を示す．
vMerge
merged collection of values
represents a feature value which is the result of merging together the feature values contained by its children, using the organization specified by the org attribute. 属性orgで示された構造を使い，子要素が持つ値とマージした結 果得られた素性値を示す．
 
 @org
indicates the organization of the resulting merged values as set, bag or list. 構造値をマージした結果の構造を示す．例えば，集合，バック，リスト など．
 
  set
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a set. 結果として得られた値の構造が，集合(順序なし，重複なし)である ことを示す．
  bag
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a bag (multiset). 結果として得られた値の構造が，バック(順序なし，重複あり)であ ることを示す．
  list
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a list. 結果として得られた値の構造が，リスト(順序あり，重複あり)であ ることを示す．
vNot
value negation
represents a feature value which is the negation of its content. 当該要素の内容の否定する素性値を示す．
vRange
value range
defines the range of allowed values for a feature, in the form of an fs, vAlt, or primitive value; for the value of an f to be valid, it must be subsumed by the specified range; if the f contains multiple values (as sanctioned by the org attribute), then each value must be subsumed by the vRange. 要素fs, vAltで示される素性値の範囲を定義する．要素 fの妥当な値は，その範囲内になければならない．要素f が複数の値をとる場合(属性orgがそれを認めている時)，各値は当該要素 vRangeが示す範囲内になければならない．

19. [nets] Graphs, networks, and trees

19.1. Elements

arc
encodes an arc, the connection from one node to another in a graph. グラフを構成するノード間の辺を示す．
 
 @from
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent from this arc. 当該辺が有向である場合，起点となるノードを示す．
 @to
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent to this arc. 当該辺が有効である場合，終点となるノードを示す．
eLeaf
leaf or terminal node of an embedding tree
provides explicitly for a leaf of an embedding tree, which may also be encoded with the eTree element. 部分木における葉を示す．要素eTree中で使用される．
 
 @value
provides the value of an embedding leaf, which is a feature structure or other analytic element. 部分木の葉の値を示す．この葉は，素性構造または他の分析に関する要 素である．
eTree
embedding tree
provides an alternative to tree element for representing ordered rooted tree structures. 順序付き根付き木を構成する部分木を示す．
 
 @value
provides the value of an embedding tree, which is a feature structure or other analytic element. 当該部分木の値を示す．素性構造または他の分析に関する要素になる．
forest
provides for groups of rooted trees. 根付き木のの集合を示す．
 
 @type
identifies the type of the forest. 当該森の種類を示す．
forestGrp
forest group
provides for groups of forests. 森の集合を示す．
 
 @type
identifies the type of the forest group. 当該森集合の種類を示す．
graph
encodes a graph, which is a collection of nodes, and arcs which connect the nodes. グラフを示す．ノードと矢(無向の場合は辺)の集合．
 
 @type
describes the type of graph. 当該グラフの種類を示す．
 
  undirected
undirected graph 無向グラフ．
  directed
directed graph 有向グラフ．
  transitionNetwork
a directed graph with distinguished initial and final nodes 遷移ネットワーク．初期ノードと最終ノードを分けた有向グラフ．
  transducer
a transition network with up to two labels on each arc トランスデューサ．各矢に高々2つのラベルを持つ遷移ネットワーク．
 @order
states the order of the graph, i.e., the number of its nodes. 当該グラフのオーダー．グラフに含まれるノード数を示す．
 @size
states the size of the graph, i.e., the number of its arcs. 当該グラフのサイズ．グラフに含まれる辺数を示す．
iNode
intermediate (or internal) node
represents an intermediate (or internal) node of a tree. 木における内部ノードを示す．
 
 @value
provides the value of an intermediate node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element. 内部ノードの値を示す．素性構造向け要素または分析向け要素になる．
 @children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the intermediate node. 当該内部ノードの子要素の識別子をまとめたリストを示す．
 @parent
provides the identifier of the element which is the parent of this node. 当該ノードの親要素の識別子を示す．
 @ord
orderedNo ja for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the internal node is ordered. 当該内部ノードが順序付きかどうかを示す．
 @follow
provides an identifier of the element which this node follows. 当該ノードの姉要素の識別子を示す．
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of an intermediate node, the number of its children. 内部ノードの出の次数(子要素の数)を示す．
leaf
encodes the leaves (terminal nodes) of a tree. 木(構造)における葉(終端ノード)を示す．
 
 @value
provides a pointer to a feature structure or other analytic element. 素性構造または他の分析要素へのポインタを示す．
 @parent
provides the identifier of parent of a leaf. 葉の親要素の識別子を示す．
 @follow
provides an identifier of an element which this leaf follows. 当該葉の姉要素の識別子を示す．
node
encodes a node, a possibly labeled point in a graph. グラフのラベル付きノードを示す．
 
 @value
provides the value of a node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element. ノードの値を示す．これは，素性構造または他の分析要素である．
 @type
provides a type for a node. ノードの種類を示す．
 
  initial
initial node in a transition network 遷移ネットワークの初期ノード．
  final
final node in a transition network 遷移ネットワークの最終ノード．
 @adjTo
adjacent toNo ja for "adjacent to"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent to the current node. 有向グラフにおける，現行ノードに入るノードの識別子を示す．
 @adjFrom
adjacent fromNo ja for "adjacent from"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent from the current node. 有向グラフにおける，現行ノードから出るノードの識別子を示す．
 @adj
adjacentNo ja for "adjacent"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are both adjacent to and adjacent from the current node. 無向グラフにおける，現行ノードに隣接するノードの識別子を示す．
 @inDegree
gives the in degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent from the given node. 現行ノードの入りの次数．すなわち，ノードへ入る辺の数．
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent to the given node. 現行ノードの出の次数．すなわち，ノードから出る辺の数．
 @degree
gives the degree of the node, the number of arcs with which the node is incident. 当該ノードの次数．すなわち，ノードにある辺の数．
root
root node
represents the root node of a tree. 木の根要素を示す．
 
 @value
provides the value of the root, which is a feature structure or other analytic element. 当該根要素の値絵お示す．これは，素性構造または他の分析要素となる．
 @children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the root node. 当該根要素の子要素となる要素の識別子のリストを示す．
 @ord
orderedNo ja for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the root is ordered. 当該根要素が，順序付きかどうかを示す．
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of the root, the number of its children. 当該根要素の出の次数，すなわち子要素の数を示す．
tree
encodes a tree, which is made up of a root, internal nodes, leaves, and arcs from root to leaves. 根，内部ノード，葉，矢(または辺)から成る木を示す．
 
 @arity
gives the maximum number of children of the root and internal nodes of the tree. 木構造における，根や内部ノードが持つ子供の最大数を示す．
 @ord
orderedNo ja for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the tree is ordered, or if it is partially ordered. 当該木構造が，順序付き木，または半順序付き木であるかどうかを示す．
 
  true
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered. 木構造中の全ノードは，順序付きであることを示す．
  partial
indicates that some of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered and some are unordered. 木構造中のノードの一部は順序付きであるが，一部は順序付きでは ないことを示す．
  false
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are unordered. 木構造の全ノードは，順序付きではないことを示す．
 @order
gives the order of the tree, i.e., the number of its nodes. 木構造の順番を示す．例えば，ノードの番号を示す．
triangle
underspecified embedding tree, so called because of its characteristic shape when drawn
Provides for an underspecified eTree, that is, an eTree with information left out. 未定義の部分木(eTree)，すなわち情報が付与されていない部分木を示す．
 
 @value
provides the value of a triangle, which is the identifier of a feature structure or other analytic element. 省略部分木の値を示す．素性構造または他の分析要素の識別子になる．

20. [certainty] Certainty and uncertainty

20.1. Elements

certainty
indicates the degree of certainty or uncertainty associated with some aspect of the text markup. 当該マークアップの確信度を示す．
 
 @target
points at the elements whose markup is uncertain. 確信度の対象となる要素を示す．
 @locus
indicates the precise location of the uncertainty in the markup: applicability of the element, precise position of the start- or end-tag, value of a specific attribute, etc. 当該確信度が該当する場所の詳細を示す．例えば，要素全体，開始タグ または終了タグの正確な位置，特定属性の値，など．
 
  gi
element nameNo ja for "element name"
uncertain whether the element used actually applies to the passage. 要素全体に対する不確かさ．
  startLoc
start locationNo ja for "start location"
start-tag may not be correctly located. 開始タグに対する不確かさ．
  endLoc
end locationNo ja for "end location"
end-tag may not be correctly located. 終了タグに対する不確かさ．
  location
both the start-tag and the end-tag may not be correctly located. 開始タグ・終了タグの両方に対する不確かさ．
  attrName
attribute nameNo ja for "attribute name"
the value given for the attribute name is uncertain. 当該属性の値に対する不確かさ．
  transcribedContent
the content of the element may not be a correct transcription of the source text. 当該要素の内容は，元テキストからの正しい転記ではないかもしれ ない．
  suppliedContent
the content of the element may not have been correctly supplied by the reader, e.g. as in the cases of corr and abbrev elements. 当該要素の内容は，利用者から正しく付与されていないかもしれな い．例えば，要素corrやabbrevが付与されている場合．
 @assertedValue
provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question—an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text. 懸案の部分に対する代替値を示す．例えば，共通識別子(GI)，転記，属 性値，(他の開始・終了地点を示す)要素anchorの識別子，な ど．属性assertedValueがある場合，属性 degreeで定義された確信度は，属性 assertedValueにある値への確信度を示す． 何もない場合には，当該テキスト中の当該マークアップに該当する．
 @given
indicates conditions assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence. 当該確信度が成立する条件を示す．
 @degree
indicates the degree of confidence assigned to the aspect of the markup named by the locus attribute. 属性locusで示された対象のに付与される確信度の程度を示 す．
respons
responsibility
identifies the individual(s) responsible for some aspect of the markup of particular element(s). ある要素の決定に責任のある個人を特定する．
 
 @target
gives the identifier(s) of the element(s) for which some aspect of the responsibility is being assigned. 当該責任と関連する要素の識別子を示す．
 @locus
indicates the specific aspect of the markup for which responsibility is being assigned. 当該責任を示すマークアップが何についてのものかを示す．
 
  gi
element nameNo ja for "element name"
responsibility for the claim that the element is of the type indicated by the markup 責任は，当該マークアップによる示された属性の種類にある．
  location
responsibility for the claim that the element begins and ends where indicated 責任は，当該要素の始点や終点にある．
  startLoc
start locationNo ja for "start location"
responsibility for the claim that the element begins where indicated 責任は，当該要素の始点にある．
  endLoc
end locationNo ja for "end location"
responsibility for the claim that the element ends where indicated 責任は，当該要素の終点にある．
  attrName
attribute nameNo ja for "attribute name"
responsibility for the claim that the name attribute has the value given in the markup 責任は，当該マークアップにある属性名にある．
  transcribedContent
responsibility for the transcription of the element content 責任は，当該要素の，転記された内容にある．
  suppliedContent
responsibility for the contents supplied by the encoder (corrections, expansions of abbreviations, etc.) 責任は，符号化する人が付加した内容(校正，略語の展開など)にあ る．
 @resp
responsible partyNo ja for "responsible party"
identifies the individual or agency responsible for the indicated aspect of the electronic text. 当該電子テキストのある面にに責任のある個人や主体を示す．

21. [tagdocs] Documentation of TEI modules

21.1. Attribute classes

att.identified
provides attributes for elements which can be referenced by means of a key attribute. 属性keyで参照されている要素に付与する属性を示す．
 
 @ident
Supplies the identifier by which this element is referenced. 当該要素を参照する識別子を示す．
 @predeclare
Says whether this object should be predeclared in the tei infrastructure module. 当該オブジェクトが，TEI基盤モジュー ルで事前に宣言されるべきかどうかを示す．
 @module
Supplies the name of the module in which this object is to be defined. 当該オブジェクトが定義されているモジュール名を示す．
 @mode
specifies the effect of this declaration on its parent module. 当該宣言が親要素に与える影響を示す．
 
  add
this declaration is added to the current definitions 当該宣言は現行定義に追加される．
  delete
this declaration and all of its children are removed from the current setup 当該宣言と当該以下の子要素は，現行定義から外される．
  change
this declaration changes the declaration of the same name in the current definition 当該宣言は，現行定義中の同名宣言を修正する．
  replace
this declaration replaces the declaration of the same name in the current definition 当該宣言は，現行定義中の同名宣言に置き換わる．

21.2. Model classes

att.identified
provides attributes for elements which can be referenced by means of a key attribute. 属性keyで参照されている要素に付与する属性を示す．

 @module
Supplies the name of the module in which this object is to be defined. 当該オブジェクトが定義されているモジュール名を示す．
 @mode
specifies the effect of this declaration on its parent module. 当該宣言が親要素に与える影響を示す．
 
  add
this declaration is added to the current definitions 当該宣言は現行定義に追加される．
  delete
this declaration and all of its children are removed from the current setup 当該宣言と当該以下の子要素は，現行定義から外される．
  change
this declaration changes the declaration of the same name in the current definition 当該宣言は，現行定義中の同名宣言を修正する．
  replace

  closed
only the values specified are permitted. 許可された値のみ．
  semi
semi-openNo ja for "semi-open"
all the values specified should be supported, but other values are legal and software should have appropriate fallback processing for them. 付与される全値が支持されるべきであるが，その他の値も可能であ る．ソフトウェアは，そのための適切な代替処理を用意すべきであ る．
  open
the values specified are sample values only. 付与された値は，参考値である．

21.4. Macros

macro.schemaPattern
provides a pattern to match elements from the chosen schema language 選択されたスキーマ言語による，要素にマッチするパタン．
